required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 0050-19-RMB CTIL - VNOTES Compared to VH for Vaginal Apex Prolapse
clinical_study.official_title: Transvaginal Natural Orifice Transluminal Endoscopic Surgery (vNOTES) Compared With Traditional Vaginal Utero-sacral Ligament Suspension for Vaginal Apex Prolapse

brief_summary.textblock: VNOTES (Transvaginal natural orifice transluminal endoscopic surgery) is a relatively new surgery for Hysterectomy and Uterosacral ligament suspension to treat Vaginal prolapse. The investigators wish to run a randomized control trial comparing it to classic Vaginal hysterectomy for the same indication.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will recruit 60 women with indication for surgery to treat uterine prolapse. 30 women will undergo VNOTES surgery and 30 women will undergo classic vaginal hysterectomy. The investigators will compare outcomes of the surgeries such as surgery time, bleeding and clinical outcomes after 3 and 6 months post operation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from admission up to 6 hours post operation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from admission up to 6 hours post operation
secondary_outcome.description: bleeding at surgery - volume of blood loss estimated by the surgeon performing the operation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from admission up to 96 hours post operation
secondary_outcome.description: how many days after surgery for hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: PISQ12 score - Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from admission up to 6 hours post operation
secondary_outcome.description: Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire is a scoring index used to measure sexual function of women affected by pelvic organ prolapse. range 0-48. 0 marks good sexual function and 48 measures sexual disability affected from pelvic organ prolapse

secondary_outcome.measure: PFDI score - Pelvic Floor Disability Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from admission up to 6 hours post operation
secondary_outcome.description: The Pelvic Floor Disability Index is an index used to obtain an objective score regarding pelvic floor disability comprising of bowel, bladder, or pelvic symptoms over the last 3 months prior to answering the questionnaire. score ranges 0-300. 0 outcome is no pelvic floor disability and 300 marks a high level of pelvic floor disability.

arm_group.description: treatment of Vaginal prolapse with VNOTES surgery and apical suspension to the uterosacral ligaments.
treatment of Vaginal prolapse with classic vaginal hysterectomy surgery and apical suspension to the uterosacral ligaments.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women with vaginal prolapse
- capable of having a surgery - assessed by an anesthesiologist
- women who approve of having the surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI over 40
- women who have recurrent PID (pelvic inflammatory disease)
- women with oncology records

eligibility.gender_description: only women suffer from vaginal prolapse
